Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 25. Attaining the Unsurpassable Wisdom of Perfect Awakening.

During the first watch of the night, the Bodhisattva rested in meditative equipoise on the nature of suchness. Based upon the final concentration, he achieved the extra-perception of performing miracles and the divine ear. During the second watch, he achieved the extra-perception of knowing the minds of others, the recollection of his past lives, and the divine eye. During the third watch, he achieved the extra-perception of the exhaustion of defilements. He attained unsurpassed wisdom, reached perfect awakening, and became omniscient, a Thus Gone One.
Manual - English: Although it is the same night when the Buddha tames the demon and becomes the Buddha, there is a major difference, so there is no need to draw the Buddha achieving enlightenment in a separate scene. The Buddha sits in equanimity on the grass mattress under the Bodhi Tree. His body radiates infinite rays of light.
Scene working notes: Vinayavastu: "de nam gyi thun tha ma la 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs." (32b.5-6)

Sun of Faith - English: Then the demonic gods proclaimed throughout Kapilavastu, "The Bodhisattva has died!" And everyone grieved. But the virtuous gods proclaimed, "Shakyamuni has not died! He has just attained unsurpassed wisdom." And everyone rejoiced.

So did the Blessed One attain unsurpassed wisdom full-moon night of the Saga Month. And in that month there was also a lunar eclipse. Yashodhara's son Rahula was born. Amritodana's son Ananda was also born.

The great Earth quaked. Bright light filled all of space and every dark region of the world was also filled with light. In Kapilavastu a pavillion was built and filled with offerings, meritorious deeds carried out, and a great feast held.
The Blessed One, the One Gone Thus, Shakyamuni reached perfect awakening. He rested evenly on the element of fire without leaving the cross-legged vajra posture and in that way seven days passed.
